question: What is the name of the 7th Indian Coast Guard Offshore Patrol Vessel that was commissioned in Chennai?
explanation:
The seventh offshore patrol vessel of the Indian Coast Guard (ICG), 'Vigraha' was formally commissioned at Kattupalli port, Chennai.
The vessel was built by Larsen and Toubro and is the last in the series of seven offshore patrol vessels contracted to the company by the Ministry of Defence in 2015. This is the first time a private sector shipyard has undertaken the design and construction of OPV class of ships.
